channel.title: JAlarm
channel.description:
[CENTER][IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/iz4ykh.png[/img][/CENTER]
JAlarm is an alarm application written in Java. The application utilizes JLayer for mp3 integration and audio support. All other content written or used within the application are designed solely by the Arsenal Development Team, lead programmer Emily (myself). The program uses a decent usage of multi-threading along with both basic script, and sound design script support.
Download Link: [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?bgtj2iy73hi2gls]JAlarm.rar[/url]
Application Design Script: The script is very basic and limited to RGB color values in an external file. The line numbers in your script file should pertain as follows: Index Listings: (Line 1 = First line of File) (Format for colors is "0,0,0" (ignore quotes)) [CODE] 1 - Description/Title of Script 2 - Frame Background 3 - Month box background 4 - Day box background 5 - Hour box background 6 - Minute box background 7 - AM/PM box background 8 - Year box background 9 - View Button Background 10 - Informational Button Background 11 - Alarm Button Background 12 - Reminder Text Field Background 13 - Current Hour Box A Background 14 - Current Hour Box B Background 15 - Current Minute Box A Background 16 - Current Minute Box B Background 17 - Current AM/PM Box Background 18 - Color Symbol Box Background 19 - Current Hour Box A Text Color 20 - Current Hour Box B Text Color 21 - Current Minute Box A Text Color 22 - Current Minute Box B Text Color 23 - Current AM/PM Box Text Color 24 - Colon Box Text Color [/CODE]
The alarm supports multiple alarm tasks but you should not abuse it and try not to keep the application running for long periods such as weeks, months, years. The application is in a @version 1.0.0 release, and needs users to submit bug and glitch reports. Task cleanup was removed on concurrent processing problem, so memory usage consumed by growing HashMap is notable.
[B]Do not solely rely on this program as your alarm application. It has not been tested on a level to provide an accurate judgement on its reliability[/B]
The application will (is supposed to) open the alarm, regardless as to if the frame is minimized or not. The application [b]must[/b] be running for the alarm to work.
Application Initial Launch Appearance (Using BlackSkin) [IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/28rpi6w.png[/img]
Please remember to click [B]close[/b] and do not exit with the red X. [B]*NOTE*[/B] Do not use the remove function or you will get concurrent processing errors. [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/30a7sk8.png[/img]
Both dismiss and snooze functions should work appropriately. [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/esu4hv.png[/img]
[B]Forgot to mention you need Java 7 for this to work[/B]

item.title: JAlarm
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Davidi2:

I don’t want to download, but what do you need java 7 for? If it’s the ‘invalid major.minor version’ error, you can just compile it with jdk6 and it should work. If you’re actually using java 7 stuff… blame oracle for their bad backwards compatability

Can’t blame them for introducing an entirely new opcode (we’ll ignore the fact that we knew about it since Java 5).

Read full topic

item.title: JAlarm
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:4, topic:432714”][quote author=Pure Slay link=topic=535426.msg3914460#msg3914460 date=1329033950]

I don’t want to download, but what do you need java 7 for? If it’s the ‘invalid major.minor version’ error, you can just compile it with jdk6 and it should work. If you’re actually using java 7 stuff… blame oracle for their bad backwards compatability

After rechecking source files, the file that I had using Java 7 string switch, I ended up removing. If you recompile it should work fine.
[/quote]

Solution: Edit the major/minor number in all the class files to Java 1 and set the magic number to ‘l33thax’[/quote]stfu cafebabe

Read full topic

item.title: JAlarm
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:3, topic:432714”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=535426.msg3914457#msg3914457 date=1329033784]
I don’t want to download, but what do you need java 7 for? If it’s the ‘invalid major.minor version’ error, you can just compile it with jdk6 and it should work. If you’re actually using java 7 stuff… blame oracle for their bad backwards compatability
[/quote]

After rechecking source files, the file that I had using Java 7 string switch, I ended up removing. If you recompile it should work fine.[/quote]

Solution: Edit the major/minor number in all the class files to Java 1 and set the magic number to ‘l33thax’

Read full topic

item.title: JAlarm
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

Davidi2:

I don’t want to download, but what do you need java 7 for? If it’s the ‘invalid major.minor version’ error, you can just compile it with jdk6 and it should work. If you’re actually using java 7 stuff… blame oracle for their bad backwards compatability

After rechecking source files, the file that I had using Java 7 string switch, I ended up removing. If you recompile it should work fine.

Read full topic

item.title: JAlarm
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[CENTER][/CENTER]

JAlarm is an alarm application written in Java. The application utilizes JLayer for mp3 integration and audio support. All other content written or used within the application are designed solely by the Arsenal Development Team, lead programmer Emily (myself). The program uses a decent usage of multi-threading along with both basic script, and sound design script support.

Download Link: JAlarm.rar

Application Design Script:
The script is very basic and limited to RGB color values in an external file.
The line numbers in your script file should pertain as follows:
Index Listings:
(Line 1 = First line of File)
(Format for colors is “0,0,0” (ignore quotes))

1 - Description/Title of Script
2 - Frame Background
3 - Month box background
4 - Day box background
5 - Hour box background
6 - Minute box background
7 - AM/PM box background
8 - Year box background
9 - View Button Background
10 - Informational Button Background
11 - Alarm Button Background
12 - Reminder Text Field Background
13 - Current Hour Box A Background
14 - Current Hour Box B Background
15 - Current Minute Box A Background
16 - Current Minute Box B Background
17 - Current AM/PM Box Background
18 - Color Symbol Box Background
19 - Current Hour Box A Text Color
20 - Current Hour Box B Text Color
21 - Current Minute Box A Text Color
22 - Current Minute Box B Text Color
23 - Current AM/PM Box Text Color
24 - Colon Box Text Color

The alarm supports multiple alarm tasks but you should not abuse it and try not to keep the application running for long periods such as weeks, months, years. The application is in a @version 1.0.0 release, and needs users to submit bug and glitch reports. Task cleanup was removed on concurrent processing problem, so memory usage consumed by growing HashMap is notable.

Do not solely rely on this program as your alarm application. It has not been tested on a level to provide an accurate judgement on its reliability

The application will (is supposed to) open the alarm, regardless as to if the frame is minimized or not. The application must be running for the alarm to work.

Application Initial Launch Appearance (Using BlackSkin)

Please remember to click close and do not exit with the red X.
NOTE Do not use the remove function or you will get concurrent processing errors.

Both dismiss and snooze functions should work appropriately.

Forgot to mention you need Java 7 for this to work

Read full topic
